length - a) the linear extent of any thing as measured from end to end; b) the greater of two or greatest of three dimensions of a body or figure; c) the extent of a garment in a vertical direction when worn; d) the extent from beginning to end, esp. of a period of time, a speech, etc; e) the full extent of one's body; f) (long) stretch or extent of land, hair, etc.; g) a unit of measure consisting of the length of an object (as, a man of standard height, in measuring the depth or height).

its black seedpod; black gram.

ಉದ್ದುಹುರಿ uddu huri (fig.) to be engaged in a useless activity; ಉದ್ದು ಉಬ್ಬಿದರೆ ಮದ್ದಳೆ ಆದೀತೆ? uddu ubbidare maddaḷe ādīte? (prov.) an ant-hill, however big it grows, cannot challenge the Everest; ಉದ್ದು ಉರುಳಿದರೆ ಹೆದ್ದಾರಿ ದಾಟೀತೆ? uddu uruḷidare heddāri dāṭīte? (prov.) one must know his limitations; ಉದ್ದು ಮದ್ದಲ್ಲ, ನಿದ್ದೆ ಯೋಗಿಗೆ ಸಲ್ಲ uddu maddige salla, nidde yōgige salla (prov.) utility of any thing must not be exaggerated nor should it be misconstrued; ಉದ್ದು ಮದ್ದಲ್ಲ, ಕಳ್ಳ ಸಬಗನಲ್ಲ್ಲ uddu maddige salla, kaḷḷa sabaganalla (prov.) = ಉದ್ದು ಮದ್ದಲ್ಲ, ನಿದ್ದೆ ಯೋಗಿಗೆ ಸಲ್ಲ.
= ಉದ್ದಿಮೆ.
to take upon oneself; to agree to do; to enter into or upon (as a task, etc.); to undertake.
a brutal, violent, lawless man; a hoodlum; a ruffian.
harsh, rude, brutal, etc.; not gentle or mild; coarse in manner, tastes, etc.; lacking refinement or culture.
very strong; physically more powerful; robust.
= ಉದ್ದುರುಟುತನ.

the quality of being harsh, rude or brutal; lack of gentleness; the condition of lacking refinement or culture; ಉದ್ದುರುಟುತನಕ್ಕೆ ಗುದ್ದೇ ಮದ್ದು udduruṭutanakke guddē maddu (prov.) stubbornness is the preferred medicine for treating presumption.
a long heavy iron bar used in a war to smash a rival soldier.
= ಉದ್ದೇಶ - 1.
an end in view; an object; an aim; purpose.
a judgement, conviction or belief falling short of positive knowledge; a view regarded as probable; an opinion.
(phil.) the enunciation of a thing by its name (which is to be further discussed and explained) (the other two processes being ಲಕ್ಷಣ and ಪರೀಕ್ಷೆ).
done or carried out intentionally; intentional; deliberate; purposeful.
(modifying a verb such as 'do') deliberately; intentionally; wilfully.
purposive - a) having or serving a purpose; b) done with a purpose.
purposiveness - a) the fact of having or serving a purpose; b) the fact of being done with a purpose.
(phil. & log.) that part of a statement or utterance, which is followed by another.
planned to be done; aimed; kept as an object; proposed.
to direct (one's efforts); to try to achieve; to aim.
to direct (spoken or written words to).
to mean (something) to be or be used (for); to intend.
the object in mind (to achieve, to arrive at, to be proved, etc.).
that of which something is predicated; a subject.
(log.) the subject of an assertion.
the explanation of phenomena by the purpose they serve rather than by postulated causes; teleology.
a brutal, violent, uncivilised, lawless man; a hoodlum; a ruffian.
the quality of being harsh, rude or brutal; lack of gentleness; the codition of lacking refinement or culture; impudence; unashamed boldness; effrontery; contumacy.
an unashamedly bold woman; an impudent woman.
raised up; elevated; lifted.
having or showing great pride in oneself and disdain or contempt for others; haughty.
excited; inflamed.
stirred up or encouraged for action.
reckless; rude; brutal.
up-rooted; pulled out completely; destroyed fully.
a wrestler in a king's court.
an arrogant man.
an eminent man; a man of high rank.
in a grand, majestic way.
to exhibit in a majestic way.
a strong or haughty advocate of an idea, philosophy, religion, etc.
a proud, arrogant, disdainful, supercilious man.
a proud, arrogant, disdainful, supercilious woman.
= ಉದ್ಧತವೃತ್ತ.
= ಉದ್ಧತವೃತ್ತೆ.
